title: Audrey Simmons
author: Audrey Simmons
content: How much knowledge about Bitcoin do i need before i start investing. I want price of Bitcoin to reduce so i can start my investment, anyone knows when the price of Bitcoin will fall so i can begin. I did not take my opportunity when i was introduced to Bitcoin and this forum, what should be done to correct my mistakes or am i late?

comments.author: Sanitough
comments.body: Quote from: Audrey Simmons on January 27, 2025, 09:04:25 PMHow much knowledge about Bitcoin do i need before i start investing. I want price of Bitcoin to reduce so i can start my investment, anyone knows when the price of Bitcoin will fall so i can begin. I did not take my opportunity when i was introduced to Bitcoin and this forum, what should be done to correct my mistakes or am i late? You’ll keep making the same mistake if you don’t start investing now. Since you’re new, I’d suggest keeping it simple, and that is invest in Bitcoin’s future by holding it. Also, it’s also crucial to educate yourself more about Bitcoin, so you won’t panic whenever the price dumps.From what I see, it seems like you’re experiencing FOMO since you decided to invest when the market is bullish. So I guess take your time, learn more, and don’t let emotions drive your decisions.

Or you can start to DCA little by little and invest more in 2026 if the price fall.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: Quote from: Audrey Simmons on January 27, 2025, 09:04:25 PMHow much knowledge about Bitcoin do i need before i start investing.  Basic knowledge is okay; how to buy, how to store it, and what exactly Bitcoin is, then you are good to go. You can learn all this in just a day and remove fast profit-making from your mind. QuoteI want price of Bitcoin to reduce so i can start my investment, anyone knows when the price of Bitcoin will fall so i can begin.  You might never have the opportunity to buy if you are waiting because the price may never get too low as to where you want it to get. No doubt, there is no bad thing about buying bitcoin cheap, but you might lose a good opportunity by waiting for a time that will take years to come.QuoteI did not take my opportunity when i was introduced to Bitcoin and this forum, what should be done to correct my mistakes or am i late? You are not late; no time is too late. You missed out on the chance when you could have purchased Bitcoin at a low price; now you have the time to correct your wrong before you will also consider today to be another late time. Buy with what you can afford and forget about the wasted days.

comments.author: Felicity_Tide
comments.body: Quote from: Audrey Simmons on January 27, 2025, 09:04:25 PMHow much knowledge about Bitcoin do i need before i start investing. It really depends on what you mean by knowledge, but for someone who wants to invest only, I would advise that you know what you are investing in. You have to know what Bitcoin truly is(Not talking about the technical part though). You have to understand that, the price goes up and down, but a long term plan will definitely benefit you. You also have to know how to make a purchase (i.e how to buy from an exchange), and you also have to identify and choose the best method to keep your investment. You wouldn't want your investment to go missing along the line due to wrong choice of storing your investment.QuoteI want price of Bitcoin to reduce so i can start my investment, anyone knows when the price of Bitcoin will fall so i can begin. From what I know, there is no general alarm or memo that is been passed around that the price of Bitcoin will dump today, or will pump tomorrow, though there can be some speculations based on activity that we all think might affect the price. But, you can not always depend on speculations though. So, let me just make it simple, no one knows specifically when the price of Bitcoin will fall.QuoteI did not take my opportunity when i was introduced to Bitcoin and this forum, what should be done to correct my mistakes or am i late? For Bitcoin, get something doing that can give you enough income to set out your Bitcoin investment funds. It's only never too late if you hit the ground running and accumulate some good fractions before your retirement or whatever time that pleases you, but remember that long term plans benefits more.And as for the forum, it's never too late as well to maybe learn or acquire the basic knowledge that you seek in starting your accumulation. You can ask further questions in the beginners board if you find anything confusing, or also read through this thread as a similar question has been asked before  Is buying Bitcoin too late?.

comments.author: alani123
comments.body: For investing you don't necessarily need to know the technical details. The thing is, if you have cash to spare from your regular income, you can invest. Bitcoin is a high risk investment still and what you should learn is the proper rules of investment and safety for personal finance. If you can't afford the risk of the value of your investment being reduced for even perhaps an expected period of time then maybe you should invest little to nothing on Bitcoin. Many people don't consider the risk but it's actually one of the most important factors.

comments.author: LogitechMouse
comments.body: Quote from: Audrey Simmons on January 27, 2025, 09:04:25 PMHow much knowledge about Bitcoin do i need before i start investing. You're the only one that can answer that question.If you feel that you have the basic information needed already then you can start investing. Just take note that the chances of you losing your money is higher since you're a newbie. You'll learn more from the experience that you will get.Quote from: Audrey Simmons on January 27, 2025, 09:04:25 PMI want price of Bitcoin to reduce so i can start my investment, anyone knows when the price of Bitcoin will fall so i can begin. You can't just ask that because also don't know when the price of Bitcoin will go down. I should say learn more first then build your own strategy. Save up some money so that when the bear market comes (search what bear market is), you will have money to use to buy Bitcoin at a much lower price.  We all want the price of Bitcoin to go down as well, but as of now, most want it to go up so they can maximize their profit. Quote from: Audrey Simmons on January 27, 2025, 09:04:25 PMI did not take my opportunity when i was introduced to Bitcoin and this forum, what should be done to correct my mistakes or am i late? There's no early or late in investing. Both have pros and cons. As for the mistakes, it's pretty normal since you're new. Opportunities come way faster than that of other asset classes, so if you missed one, don't dwell about it and focus on getting others in the future. I'm sure there will be new opportunities coming. Just be patient for it and speaking of patience, that's the one thing that you must have if you want to invest into crypto.

comments.author: promise444c5
comments.body: Quote from: Audrey Simmons on January 27, 2025, 09:37:31 PMHow can i start the DCA? DCA (Dollar Cost Average)It's simple and not complicated  all you just have to do is pick an amount you can afford to invest in a specific interval( depends on you), you must be willing to  do it consistently  and hold for a very long period (this is very important) . The purpose is just to spread your entries and could worth it than just waiting to buy when the price falls . No one can assure you the price will fall but if it does you have  opportunity to buy low as well and if it doesn't,   you already have an additional advantage and you'v yourself for the up  . Once again, if you are after the short term profit you might end up selling in loss if the price  eventually  falls before  rising back( you need to prepare for that ...)
